dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 551 IH: Make the Migrant Protection Protocols Mandatory Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Williams of Texas (for himself, Mr. Gimenez, Mr. Gill of Texas, Mr. Hamadeh of Arizona, Mr. Ellzey, Ms. Van Duyne, Mr. Bergman, Mr. Owens, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mrs. Houchin, Mr. Self, Mr. Wied, Mr. Nehls, Mr. Brecheen, Mr. Perry, Mr. Hunt, Mr. McCormick, Mr. Balderson, Mr. Ogles, Mr. Lawler, Mr. Rogers of Kentucky, Mr. Yakym, Mr. Loudermilk, Mr. Harris of Maryland, Mr. Babin, Mr. Fallon, Ms. Foxx, Mr. Finstad, Ms. Perez, Mr. Alford, Mr. Moore of Alabama, and Mr. Schmidt) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend section 235(b)(2)(C) of the Immigration and Nationality Act to require the implementation of the Migrant Protection Protocols.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Make the Migrant Protection Protocols Mandatory Act of 2025.

section.header: Mandatory implementation of the Migrant Protection Protocols
section.text: Section 235(b)(2)(C) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1225(b)(2)(C)) is amended by striking may and inserting shall.
